result.execSummary:
The defendant DeShawn F Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant DeShawn F Harris in court with attorney Lauren A Blumenthal.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 6 MONTHS.
Conditions:
*  AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate;
*  Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges by 06-13-2016or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant DeShawn F Harris in court with attorney Lauren A Blumenthal.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case passed.

Defendant DeShawn F Harris in court with attorney Lauren A Blumenthal.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant DeShawn F Harris in court with attorney Lauren A Blumenthal.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense needs additional time to work on resolving this matter with another member of the DA's office.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant DeShawn F Harris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney McGinn appears as a friend of the court.  Defendant needs time to hire an attorney.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant DeShawn F Harris in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant DeShawn F Harris in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserved Judge.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION if released from custody.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
